alert.note: Alert for Caddo; Comanche; Greer; Harmon; Jackson; Kiowa (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 17 at 11:52PM CDT until June 18 at 12:30AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Comanche County in southwestern Oklahoma... Southern Caddo County in southwestern Oklahoma... Northern Jackson County in southwestern Oklahoma... Kiowa County in southwestern Oklahoma... Central Harmon County in southwestern Oklahoma... Greer County in southwestern Oklahoma... * Until 1230 AM CDT. * At 1152 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles south of Vinson to 3 miles northeast of Blair to 6 miles northwest of Meers to near Fort Cobb, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Altus, Anadarko, Hobart, Mangum, Hollis, Elgin, Granite, Carnegie, Apache, Fletcher, Cyril, Blair, Mountain View, Sterling, Fort Cobb, Verden, Cement, Lone Wolf, Mountain Park, and Medicine Park. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Caddo; Comanche; Greer; Harmon; Jackson; Kiowa
